page.title: 02Ecology in Winchfield Area.
page.content: With the retention of hedgerows, copses, footpaths & country lanes the necessary{habitats}for all the common birds, animals, plants & insects are to be found. The{Basingstoke Canal}has Willow, Oak, Beech, Hazel Alder, Silver Birch, Holly, Scot's Pine Hawthorn, Rhododendron & Sycamore trees in a 100 metre section as well as the following{flowers:- Coltsfoot, Catmint, Sorrel, Arum Lily, Bittersweet & many others. Grasses, reeds, rushes & water-lilies are also plentiful whilst in the water are Carp, Perch, Pike & Tench.{Roe Deer, Pheasants, Badgers & Foxes are amongst the{Fauna}in the area. There is a great awareness of the need for {conservation}in the area with the Canal, an area of{Biological Interest at Greenways Farm & several rare trees in the grounds of the larger houses.
